en: Amendments to the press and publications law restricting online expression in Jordan were passed by parliament today .
amh: በዮርዳኖስ የፕሬስ እና ሕትመት ሕግ በበይነመረብ (Internet) ላይ ሐሳብን የመግለጽ መብትን እንዲያደግድ ተደርጎ ትላንት እንዲሻሻል ተደረገ፡፡
llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

amh: የአፍሪካ ሪፖረተሮች እንደ ዢኖዋ ሪፖርተሮች እንዲሆኑ በማሰልጠን ፈንታ፣ የቻይናውያን ዓላማ በምዕራባውያን ስለቻይና በአፍሪካ ኢንቨስትመንት የሚወራውን አሉታዊ ዜና የሚያስተባብል ስልጠና እና ማሕበራዊ ግንኙነት ላይ ማተኮር ይዘዋል፡፡

Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

"The person who is not able to speak the language of the country where they live will have difficulty communicating with others."

en: The establishment of modern China-Africa relations dates back to the late 1950s when China signed the first official bilateral trade agreement with Algeria, Egypt, Guinea, Somalia, Morocco and Sudan.

llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence "በ1950ዎቹ፣ ቻይና ከአልጄሪያ፣ ግብጽ፣ ጊኒ፣ ሶማሊያ፣ ሞሮኮ እና ሱዳን ጋር የጋራ ስምምነት ስትፈርም" can be translated to English as:

"In 1950, there was a great famine in Ethiopia, which caused many people to die from starvation, including children and the elderly."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there is anything else I can assist you with.</s>

en: However, ancient China-Africa relations date back as far as 202 BC and AD 220.
amh: በርግጥ፣ ጥንታዊው የቻይና-አፍሪካ ግንኙነት ከክ.

"In the morning, the sun rises in the east."

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.</s>

en: Lebanon now boasts a Virtual Museum of Censorship, an online database of censorship cases in Lebanon since the 1940s.

llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

"The person who is not able to speak the language of the country where they live will have difficulty communicating with others."

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.</s>

"May this drink bring good health to those who drink it."

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.</s>

en: On September 2, 2012, the day the Museum of Censorship was launched, MARCH said:

Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence "እዚህ ከ1940 ጀምሮ ምን አይነት ነገሮች ሳንሱር ሲደረጉ እንደነበሩ መመልከት ትችላላችኹ፡፡" can be translated to English as:

en: Feel free to report it in order to complete the database.

en: Netizens can report censored movies, music, theater pieces, books, print and audiovisual content from 1940s to date on the website.

llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

"The person who does not know how to read and write Amharic is like a bird that has no wings; he or she will never fly."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.</s>

llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

"The one who does not know how to read and write is like a tree without fruit."

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.</s>

en: While, in 1990 LBC International received threats from the National Audiovisual Media Council to suspend its transmission over the broadcast of an interview with David Levy, the Israeli foreign Minister at that time.

"The students who study diligently in the library will surely achieve their goals."

"The student who studies diligently and does not waste time will achieve great success."

en: Then he pretended to be very open minded said that he was aware that some people wanted to throw things at him and invited them to throw stuff.
amh: አሰከትለውም በጣም ግልፅ ለመምሰል ሞከሩ እናም አንዳንድ ሰዎችም የተለያዩ ነገሮችን ሊወረውሩ እንደሚችሉ ይገባኛል አይነት ሀሳብ በማምጣት፤ ለዛም ዝግጁ እንደሆኑ ገለፁ፡፡
llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:

"I will go to the market tomorrow and buy some vegetables and fruits, God willing."

Here is the breakdown of the sentence:

* አሰከትለውም (āsəkētī lewāwa) - "I will go"
* በጣም (bēṭä) - "to the market"
* ግልፅ (gəllē) - "and buy"
* ለመምሰል (le mamasell) - "some"
* ሞከሩ (mokʷe) - "vegetables"
* እናም (enam) - "and"
* አንዳንድ (anadina) - "fruits"
* ሰዎችም (sewoch) - "God willing"

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.</s>

en: Since he had not started talking, people were not ready to throw things.

en: I clapped my hand without being aware of that…

en: After receiving coverage on Kenya’s radio stations such as Kiss 100, Hot 96 and Classic 105 as well as exclusive coverage by Standard Newspaper, Daily Nation and Kenya’s KTN and K24 television stations; netizens created the following hashtags to discuss the Facebook page and share their opinions about it: #campusdivasforirchmen, #HakunaKituUtafanya (there is nothing to do), #CandidatesBetterThanRomney, #TeamMafisi , #wordszawazito , #Kiss100 and #KOT.
amh: ኪስ 100፣ ሀት 96 እና ክላሲክ 105 በተሰኙ የኬንያ ሬድዮ ጣቢያዎች እና በተለይ ደግሞ በስታንዳርድ ጋዜጣ፣ ዴይሊ ኔሽን እና የኬንያ ኬቲኤን እና ኬ24 ቴሌቪዥኖች ሰፊ ሽፋን ከተሰጠው በኋላ የመረብዜጎች (netizens) የሚከተሉትን ‹ሀሽታጎች› ፈጥረው በትዊተር እና ፌስቡክ ላይ አስተያየቶችን አስፍረዋል፡ - #campusdivasforirchmen፣ #HakunaKituUtafanya (ምንም ማድረግ አይቻልም)፣ #CandidatesBetterThanRomney፣ #TeamMafisi ፣ #wordszawazito ፣ #Kiss100 እና #KOT፡፡
llama:
The Amharic sentence translates to:

"One hundred and ten thousand, nine hundred and sixty-one people have liked and shared the post about Irchi Men on social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. This includes one hundred and twenty-five thousand, two hundred and forty-two netizens who have reacted with various emojis, including heart eyes, thumbs up, and laughter. Additionally, there are eighty-nine candidates who are better than Romney, and they are supported by Team Mafisi. Words like 'kiss,' 'love,' and 'team' are trending on social media along with hashtags such as #CampusDivasForIrChMen, #HakunaKituUtafanya, #CandidatesBetterThanRomney, and #KOT."</s>

en: The crónica is a Portuguese writing form that is very suited to blogging - originally published in newspapers, they are tales, sometimes true and sometimes fictionalized, that convey a point or a conceit in a very short form. In her blog Sweet Cliché, Alves writes short tales, often about love and intimate encounters.
amh: cronista” ማለት በፖርቱጋል ቋንቋ መጦመር የሚለውን ቃል ተስተካካይ ትርጉም የሚሰጥ ሲሆን - ፅሁፎቹ ባብዛኛ ጊዜ በጋዜጣ የሚታተሙ ታሪኮች አንዳንዴ እውነተኛ ተሪኮች ሌላ ጊዜ ደግሞ የፈጠራ ልብ ወለዶች ሲሆኑ ብዙውን ጊዜ የራስ ችሎታን በአጭሩ ያሳያሉ፡፡

en: A public service announcement promoting condom use to combat the spread of HIV and other diseases in Kenya was recently pulled from the airwaves after the TV spot caused an uproar among the country's religious leaders.

en: The advert, which shows a woman advising her married friend to use a condoms while engaging in an extramarital affair, was sponsored by Kenya's health ministry and foreign assistance agencies USAid and UKAid.

en: This is mostly the international recognition of the Language Movement Day called ‘Ekushey February', which is commemorated in Bangladesh since 1952.

en: The date of 21st February was chosen in homage to a number of 'language martyrs' from Bangladesh (then East Pakistan) who were shot on 21st February 1952 in Dhaka, during public protest.
amh: በ1952 በዳካ አመፅ ላይ ሳሉ በጥይት ለተገደሉ ‹የቋንቋ ሰማዕታት› መታሰቢ እንዲሆን በማለት ነው፡፡
llama:
Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence "በ1952 በዳካ አመፅ ላይ ሳሉ በጥይት ለተገደሉ ‹የቋንቋ ሰማዕታት› መታሰቢ እንዲሆን በማለት" can be translated to English as:

en: They were demonstrating to establish their mother language Bangla as a national language along with Urdu, which was chosen as the sole official language in the then newly created Pakistan.

Please note that the word "አሁን" is not a valid word in Amharic, it seems like a typo or a misspelling. The correct word should be "አአሁን" (Aa-huu). Also, the phrase "የሚችል" is not necessary and can be omitted.

So, the corrected translation would be:

"I don't understand what you mean by 'Aa-huu ምሳሌ ሊሆን የሚችል የበይነመረብ መገናኛ ብዙኃን መረጃን ለተለያዩ አገር �������

Sure, I'd be happy to help! The Amharic sentence you provided translates to:
